page.title: 04SHOPPING SURVEY IN WALSALL
page.content: On a{Friday in June 1985, 350 shoppers were interviewed at different points in{Walsall town centre,}between{10.15 {am}and{12.30pm.}Of those interviewed {84%}lived in{Walsall.}56% came by bus, 31% by private car and 12% lived close enough to walk. Friday is a market day and{78%}had bought or intended to buy {groceries}only but 20% had also bought items like clothing and shoes. 65% said they would buy costly items like furniture in Walsall. For expensive items{Birmingham}was a significant secondary centre. Walsall has other important functions. {51% of shoppers}had also come to use either its{services}e.g. library, banks, hospitals, hairdressers etc, its{entertainment and social facilities e.g. swimming pool, cinema etc or had come to{work}in the town.
